comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Gibson appears to be Burton W. Gibson an attorney accused of murdering his client, Mrs. Rosa Szabo of Austria, while they were in a rowboat. query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?_r=1&res=9C04E... Gibson was tried twice, jury vote was 11-1 (it seems to be the "OJ" case of 1912.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: NYT query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B07E7DE133CE633A... indicates that Gibson was arrested at his offices (he was a lawyer) in Liberty Street, Manhattan. NYT of Sep 14, 1912, query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9A06E6D7123CE6... suggests that arrest will have happened on Sept 12, 1912
